title: Predictive performance of power posteriors
authors: Yann McLatchie, Edwin Fong, David T. Frazier, Jeremias Knoblauch
abstract:
We analyse the impact of using tempered likelihoods in the production of
posterior predictions. Our findings reveal that once the sample size is at
least moderately large and the temperature is not too small, then likelihood
tempering has virtually no impact on the resulting posterior predictions.
